holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day is the first day of a new year according to the Gregorian calendar used in Canada and many other countries.

holidays.name: Day After New Year’s Day
holidays.description: The day after New Year’s Day is an annual holiday for many citizens in Quebec, Canada, on January 2.

holidays.name: Day off for New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day is the first day of a new year according to the Gregorian calendar used in Canada and many other countries.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Many people in Canada annually observe Epiphany, or Three Kings’ Day, on January 6. It is a Christian observance.

holidays.name: Orthodox Christmas Day
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christian churches in countries such as Canada observe Christmas Day on or near January 7 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Orthodox New Year
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christian churches in countries such as Canada celebrate New Year’s Day on January 14 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Tu B'Shevat (Arbor Day)
holidays.description: Tu B’Shevat is known as the “New Year for Trees”, is a Jewish festival that marks the start of a new cycle for the tithe on fruit trees.

holidays.name: Lunar New Year
holidays.description: Lunar New Year marks the first day of the New Year in the Chinese calendar.

holidays.name: Groundhog Day
holidays.description: Groundhog Day is celebrated in Canada on February 2 each year.

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: On Valentine's Day, people pronounce or re-affirm their feelings of romantic love for someone, often by sending cards or giving gifts.

holidays.name: National Flag of Canada Day
holidays.description: Flag Day in Canada commemorates the inauguration of the Canadian national flag, which features a red maple leaf on a red and white background.

holidays.name: Louis Riel Day
holidays.description: Louis Riel Day celebrates the achievements and life of Louis Riel, a Canadian politician who was a leader of the Métis people.

holidays.name: Nova Scotia Heritage Day
holidays.description: Nova Scotia Heritage Day is a day off for Canadians in Nova Scotia. It aims to recognize cultural or historical contributions to the province.

holidays.name: Islander Day
holidays.description: Islander Day is a day off for many people in the province of Prince Edward Island in Canada.

holidays.name: Family Day
holidays.description: Family Day is a public holiday in the Canadian provinces of Alberta, Ontario, Saskatchewan, British Columbia, and New Brunswick.

holidays.name: Family Day
holidays.description: Family Day is a public holiday in the Canadian provinces of Alberta, Ontario, Saskatchewan, British Columbia, and New Brunswick.

holidays.name: Yukon Heritage Day
holidays.description: National Heritage Day, also known as Heritage Day, is usually celebrated in the Yukon in Canada on the last Friday of February.

holidays.name: Carnival / Shrove Tuesday / Pancake Day
holidays.description: Shrove Tuesday is the day before Ash Wednesday. It may coincide with the winter carnival season in Canada.

holidays.name: Isra and Mi'raj
holidays.description: Isra and Mi'raj (Isra Me'raj, Israa and Mi'raaj, Laylat Al-Isra wa Al-Miraj, Lailat al Miraj, Night Journey and Ascension to Heaven) marks the night when the Prophet Mohammad traveled from Mecca to Jerusalem, ascended to heaven and returned.

holidays.name: St David's Day
holidays.description: Many Welsh communities in Canada annually celebrate the life St David, who is Wales’ patron saint, on St David’s Day on March 1.

holidays.name: Ash Wednesday
holidays.description: Ash Wednesday marks the first day of Lent in for many Christians in Canada.

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time starts
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time starts in Canada

holidays.name: Commonwealth Day
holidays.description: The Commonwealth of Nations, which includes Canada, is commemorated on Commonwealth Day.

holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day
holidays.description: St Patrick's Day commemorates the life and work of St Patrick, a Christian missionary who lived in the fourth and fifth centuries.

holidays.name: Purim
holidays.description: Purim commemorates a time when Jewish people were saved from death around the fourth century BCE, according to the Book of Esther.

holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day
holidays.description: St Patrick's Day commemorates the life and work of St Patrick, a Christian missionary who lived in the fourth and fifth centuries.

holidays.name: March Equinox
holidays.description: March Equinox in Canada (Ottawa)

holidays.name: Ramadan Start
holidays.description: Many Muslims in Canada welcome Ramadan as period of fasting, self-evaluation and spiritual growth. Ramadan is the ninth month in the Islamic calendar.

holidays.name: Tartan Day
holidays.description: Tartan Day is a special day for Canadians to celebrate their national, provincial, territorial or personal tartans.

holidays.name: Vimy Ridge Day
holidays.description: Vimy Ridge Day commemorates the Canadian soldier’s battle and victory at Vimy Ridge in France during the First World War.

holidays.name: Palm Sunday
holidays.description: Palm Sunday in Canada celebrates Jesus Christ’s entry into Jerusalem. It is also the Sunday before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Many Christians in the Canada celebrate Maundy Thursday on the Thursday before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: On Good Friday, Christians commemorate the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and it is a statutory holiday in many parts of Canada.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday is the day before Easter Sunday in Canada.

holidays.name: First day of Passover
holidays.description: Passover marks the Israelites' liberation from slavery and their exodus from Egypt around 3000 years ago.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is the most important day in the Christian church calendar in Canada. It celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ after his crucifixion, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Easter Sunday is the most important day in the Christian church calendar in Canada. It celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ after his crucifixion, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and a holiday for many Canadians.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and a holiday for many Canadians.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and a holiday for many Canadians.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and a holiday for many Canadians.

holidays.name: Orthodox Good Friday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christians in Canada remember the events leading up to Jesus Christ's crucifixion on Great Friday.

holidays.name: Last day of Passover
holidays.description: The last day of Passover marks the end of the Passover period, which lasts for seven or eight days.

holidays.name: Orthodox Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox Christians in Canada remember Jesus Christ’s burial and his descent into Hades on Holy Saturday.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter
holidays.description: Orthodox Christians in Canada celebrate Jesus Christ’s resurrection on Easter Sunday, also known as Pascha.

holidays.name: Orthodox Easter Monday
holidays.description: Many Orthodox churches in Canada observe Easter Monday on the day after the Orthodox Easter Sunday date.

holidays.name: St. George's Day
holidays.description: St George’s Day is a holiday in the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador.

holidays.name: Yom HaShoah
holidays.description: Yom Hashoah commemorates the lives of about six million Jewish people who died during World War II. This observance is annually held on the 27th day of the month of Nisan.

holidays.name: Laylatul Qadr (Night of Power)
holidays.description: Laylat al-Qadr is most likely to be held on one of the last 10 days of month of Ramadan in the Islamic calendar.

holidays.name: Eid ul Fitr
holidays.description: Eid al-Fitr, which is on the first day of the Islamic month of Shawwal, marks the end of the month-long fast of Ramadan.

holidays.name: Yom HaAtzmaut
holidays.description: Many Jewish communities in Canada celebrate Yom Ha’Atzmaut, which is Israel’s Independence Day, on the fifth day of the month of Iyar in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mother’s Day is celebrated in Canada on the second Sunday of May each year.

holidays.name: Lag B'Omer
holidays.description: Many Jewish people in Canada observe Lag B’Omer on the 18th day of the month of Iyar in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: National Patriots' Day
holidays.description: National Patriots’ Day is an annual holiday in Québec, Canada, on the Monday before May 25.

holidays.name: Victoria Day
holidays.description: Victoria Day is celebrated in honor of the birthdays of both Queen Victoria and the current monarch of Canada.

holidays.name: Victoria Day
holidays.description: Victoria Day is celebrated in honor of the birthdays of both Queen Victoria and the current monarch of Canada.
holidays.locations: All except NB, NS, PE, QC

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day is the 40th day of Easter and commemorates Jesus Christ’s ascension into heaven, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Pentecost
holidays.description: Many Christians in Canada observe Pentecost, also known as Whitsunday or Whit Sunday.

holidays.name: Shavuot
holidays.description: Shavuot, also known as the Festival of Weeks, is one of three major Jewish festivals celebrated among many Jewish Canadians.

holidays.name: Whit Monday
holidays.description: Whit Monday is a Christian observance also known as Pentecost Monday. It is the day after Pentecost, or Whitsunday.

holidays.name: Trinity Sunday
holidays.description: Trinity Sunday is the first Sunday after Pentecost and is celebrated by many Christians in Canada.

holidays.name: Corpus Christi
holidays.description: Corpus Christi is a Christian observance that honors the Holy Eucharist.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day celebrates the contribution that fathers and father figures make to their children’s lives.

holidays.name: National Indigenous Peoples Day
holidays.description: National Indigenous Peoples Day celebrates Canada’s Indigenous culture and the achievements made by the country’s indigenous peoples.

holidays.name: National Indigenous Peoples Day
holidays.description: National Indigenous Peoples Day celebrates Canada’s Indigenous culture and the achievements made by the country’s indigenous peoples.

holidays.name: June Solstice
holidays.description: June Solstice in Canada (Ottawa)

holidays.name: St. Jean Baptiste Day
holidays.description: Saint Jean Baptiste Day (Fête nationale du Québec, Quebec National Holiday, la Saint-Jean, St. John the Baptist Day) is the national holiday of the Canadian province of Quebec.

holidays.name: June Holiday
holidays.description: Newfoundland and Labrador’s June holiday commemorates John Cabot’s arrival at the province on June 24, 1497.

holidays.name: Memorial Day
holidays.description: Memorial Day is observed in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada, on July 1 each year.

holidays.name: Canada Day
holidays.description: Canada Day is a federal holiday on July 1 to mark the anniversary of the date that Canada became a self-governing country.

holidays.name: Nunavut Day
holidays.description: Nunavut Day is an annual holiday in Canada's Nunavut Territory.

holidays.name: Eid ul Adha
holidays.description: Many Muslims in Canada celebrate Eid al-Adha around the 10th to the 13th days of the Islamic month of Dhu al-Hijjah.

holidays.name: Orangemen's Day
holidays.description: Orangemen's Day is a provincial holiday in Newfoundland and Labrador in Canada. It commemorates the Battle of the Boyne, which took place in 1690 outside Drogheda, now in the Republic of Ireland.

holidays.name: Muharram/Islamic New Year
holidays.description: The first day of Muharram, which is the first month in the Islamic calendar, marks the start of the Islamic New Year.

holidays.name: Civic/Provincial Day
holidays.description: Many Canadian provinces and territories have a civic holiday to celebrate some aspect of their culture or history on the first Monday of August.

holidays.name: Civic/Provincial Day
holidays.description: Many Canadian provinces and territories have a civic holiday to celebrate some aspect of their culture or history on the first Monday of August.

holidays.name: Saskatchewan Day
holidays.description: Saskatchewan Day is a common local holiday in Canada

holidays.name: Terry Fox Day
holidays.description: Terry Fox Day is a local observance in Canada

holidays.name: New Brunswick Day
holidays.description: New Brunswick Day is an opportunity for Canadians from the province of New Brunswick to celebrate their history and culture. It is celebrated on the first Monday of August.

holidays.name: British Columbia Day
holidays.description: British Columbia Day is a statutory holiday in the Canadian province of British Columbia.

holidays.name: Natal Day
holidays.description: Natal Day is a civic holiday to celebrate the “birthday” of the Nova Scotia province. It is held on the first Monday of August.

holidays.name: Heritage Day
holidays.description: Heritage Day is celebrated in Alberta on the first Monday of August. Although it is not a statutory holiday, it may used as an optional holiday to celebrate Canadian heritage in the province.

holidays.name: The Royal St John's Regatta (Regatta Day)
holidays.description: Regatta Day is on the first Wednesday of August and it is a local holiday in the Canadian province Newfoundland and  Labrador.

holidays.name: Tisha B'Av
holidays.description: Tisha B’Av is on the ninth day of the month of Av in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: Ashura
holidays.description: Ashura is a Muslim in Canada

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The Feast of the Assumption of Mary in Canada is observed as a Holy Day of Obligation - a day when some Christian denominations are obliged to attend mass, on August 15 each year.

holidays.name: Discovery Day
holidays.description: Discovery Day is a public holiday in the Canadian territory of Yukon on the third Monday of August. It commemorates the anniversary of the discovery of gold in Bonanza Creek in the 19th century.

holidays.name: Gold Cup Parade
holidays.description: The Gold Cup Parade is Atlantic Canada’s largest parade and the largest parade east of Montreal. It is held annually in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada on the third Friday of August.

holidays.name: Labour Day
holidays.description: Labour Day in Canada is a holiday to campaign for workers' rights. It celebrates the achievements of these rights.

holidays.name: September Equinox
holidays.description: September Equinox in Canada (Ottawa)

holidays.name: Rosh Hashana
holidays.description: Rosh Hashana, also spelled Rosh Hashanah, is commonly known as the Jewish New Year. The event begins on the first day of Tishrei (or Tishri), which is the seventh month in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: National Day for Truth and Reconciliation
holidays.description: National Day for Truth and Reconciliation is a federal employees holiday in Canada

holidays.name: Feast of St Francis of Assisi
holidays.description: Many churches in Canada celebrate the Feast of St Francis of Assisi to honor St Francis, the patron saint of animals and the environment, on October 4 each year.

holidays.name: Yom Kippur
holidays.description: Yom Kippur is an important Jewish holiday that falls on the 10th day of the month of Tishrei in the Jewish calendar.

holidays.name: Milad un Nabi (Mawlid)
holidays.description: Eid Milad ul-Nabi marks the anniversary of the Prophet Muhammad's birth and death.

holidays.name: First day of Sukkot
holidays.description: The first day of Sukkot marks the start of the Sukkot festival for Jewish communities in many countries, including Canada.

holidays.name: Thanksgiving Day
holidays.description: Thanksgiving Day is a holiday to give thanks for the blessings in one's life, particularly the harvest. It is a day off work for many Canadians.

holidays.name: Thanksgiving Day

holidays.name: Hoshana Rabbah
holidays.description: Many Jewish communities in countries such as Canada observe the last day of Sukkot, which marks the end of the Sukkot festival.

holidays.name: Shemini Atzeret
holidays.description: Shemini Atzeret (or Shmini Atzeret) is a Jewish holiday dedicated to the love of God, while Simchat Torah (Simchas Torah or Simhat Torah) marks the end of Sukkot and celebrates the completion of the annual reading of the Torah.

holidays.name: Simchat Torah
holidays.description: Simchat Torah (Simchas Torah or Simhat Torah) is a Jewish holiday that marks the end of Sukkot and celebrates the completion of the annual reading of the Torah.

holidays.name: Healthcare Aide Day
holidays.description: Healthcare Aide Day is a local observance in Canada

holidays.name: Diwali/Deepavali
holidays.description: Diwali, also known as the Festival of Lights, marks the beginning of the Hindu New Year.

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Halloween in Canada stems from Celtic origins and marks a time when people believed spirits and the dead crossed over into the world of the living for one night.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: Many churches honor all their saints on All Saints' Day, also known as All Hallows' Day.

holidays.name: All Souls' Day
holidays.description: All Souls’ Day falls on November 2 each year. It is a day of alms giving and prayers for the dead.

holidays.name: Daylight Saving Time ends
holidays.description: Daylight Saving Time ends in Canada

holidays.name: National Aboriginal Veterans Day
holidays.description: National Aboriginal Veterans Day is a observance in Canada

holidays.name: Remembrance Day
holidays.description: Remembrance Day commemorates civilians and military personnel who lost their lives in armed conflicts.
holidays.locations: All except MB, NS, ON, QC

holidays.name: Remembrance Day
holidays.description: Remembrance Day commemorates civilians and military personnel who lost their lives in armed conflicts.

holidays.name: First Sunday of Advent
holidays.description: Many Christians in Canada celebrate the first Sunday of Advent in the lead up to Christmas.

holidays.name: Feast of the Immaculate Conception
holidays.description: The Feast of the Immaculate Conception is a Christian observance on December 8 each year.

holidays.name: Anniversary of the Statute of Westminster
holidays.description: The Anniversary of the Statute of Westminster is annually held in Canada on December 11.

holidays.name: First Day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: The first day of Hanukkah is the start of the Hanukkah period, which lasts for 8 days, from the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

holidays.name: December Solstice
holidays.description: December Solstice in Canada (Ottawa)

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve in Canada is the day before Christmas Day and always falls on December 24 according to the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve in Canada is the day before Christmas Day and always falls on December 24 according to the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christians celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ on Christmas Day in Canada.

holidays.name: Last day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: The last day of Hanukkah marks the end of the festive Jewish occasion known as Hanukkah, or Chanukah.

holidays.name: Kwanzaa (first day)
holidays.description: Kwanzaa is a week-long holiday honoring the culture and traditions of African people and their descendants worldwide.

holidays.name: Boxing Day
holidays.description: The day after Christmas Day is known as Boxing Day and is a holiday in many parts of Canada.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year's Eve is the last day of the year and the day before New Year's Day. New Year's Eve in Canada always falls on December 31 according to the Gregorian calendar.
